    A

    AlgoSquare - Class in game
    This class represent the data structure of a Cascadia game with squares for tiles and limited to 2 players player1 is a HashMap representing the number 1 player player2 is a HashMap representing the number 2 player draw is a DrawSquare representing the draw for the players card is the animalCard representing the card used for counting point (either family or intermediary)
    AlgoSquare() - Constructor for class game.AlgoSquare
     
    animal() - Method in class game.TileSquare
    the getter for the animal field
    animalAccepted() - Method in class game.TileSquare
    the getter for the animalAccepted field
    AnimalCard - Enum Class in game
    This enum represent the different cards to play Cascadia with
    askAnimalCard(ApplicationContext, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askAnimalCard makes sure the player input is correct
    askCoordinateTile(ApplicationContext, int, int, int, Set<Coordinate>) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askCoordinateTile takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
    askDraw(ApplicationContext, int, int, int, DrawSquare) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askDraw takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
    askGame(ApplicationContext, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askGame makes sure the player input is correct
    askOverpopulation(DrawSquare) - Static method in class graphics.ViewTerminal
    askOverpopulation prints the current state of the draw (over populated) and ask for player input
    askOverPpulation(ApplicationContext, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askOverPpulation takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
    askPositionWildlifeToken(ApplicationContext, int, int, int, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, Set<Coordinate>) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askPositionWildlifeToken takes player input and makes sure that it is correct, if not, it will wait for the next event until a correct event is given
    askTileBegin(ApplicationContext, int, int, int[]) - Static method in class graphics.GameControlerSquare
    askTileBegin makes sure the player input is correct

    C

    card() - Method in record class game.WildlifeCount
    Returns the value of the card record component.
    choiceAnimalCard() - Static method in class graphics.ViewTerminal
    choiceAnimalCard prints the choice for the 2 animal cards available in the terminal version
    choiceMoveTileOrWildelife(Set<Coordinate>, boolean) - Static method in class graphics.ViewTerminal
    choiceMoveTileOrWildelife prints the available tile or wildlife moves
    choiceTileBegin(int[], int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewTerminal
    choiceTileBegin prints the necessary knowledge to pick a beginning tile, which is not much since the choice is made blindly
    Coordinate - Record Class in game
    this record contains an Object representing a simple two dimensions coordinates
    Coordinate(int, int) - Constructor for record class game.Coordinate
    Creates an instance of a Coordinate record class.
    countCardScore(Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>) - Method in record class game.WildlifeCount
    Select the correct animal or calls the family or intermediate version depending on the game mode
    CountPointSquare - Record Class in game
    this record the way points are counted for a player
    CountPointSquare(Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>) - Constructor for record class game.CountPointSquare
    CountPointSquare is an overload constructor made because all players must start at 0 points
    CountPointSquare(Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, int[]) - Constructor for record class game.CountPointSquare
    Constructs a CountPointSquare Object checking that both players exist
    createDraw() - Static method in class game.DrawSquare
    createDraw is a static factory to create a draw, bet you guessed it

    D

    draw() - Method in class game.DrawSquare
    draw is the public getter for the draw field
    drawAskAnimalCard(ApplicationContext, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawAskAnimalCard prints the choice between the family and intermediate version
    drawAskTileBegin(ApplicationContext, int, int, int[]) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawAskTileBegin prints the menu to randomly pick a beginning tile, randomly from the eyes of the player
    drawHead(ApplicationContext, int, int, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, AnimalCard, DrawSquare, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawHead draws the necessary for a player to play his turn
    drawMoves(Set<Coordinate>, ApplicationContext, int, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawMoves draws the available tile moves
    drawOverPopulation(DrawSquare, ApplicationContext, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawOverPopulation draws the necessary tools for the player to interact in case of an overpopulation
    drawPlayer(ApplicationContext, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, int, int, int) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawPlayer draws the board of a player
    DrawSquare - Class in game
    DrawSquare is an Object representing the Draw for an AlgoSquare draw is a Map representing the draw of the players wildlife is a Map representing the total number of wildlife token available and left for the current game tiles is a List representing the total number of tiles available and left for this game, when none are left the game ends
    DrawSquare() - Constructor for class game.DrawSquare
     
    drawWinner(ApplicationContext, int, int, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>, AnimalCard) - Static method in class graphics.ViewGameSquare
    drawWinner prints the winner of the game and the number of points

    LandscapeCountSquare - Record Class in game
    LandscapeCountSquare counts the point for landscapes
    LandscapeCountSquare(Map<Coordinate, TileSquare>) - Constructor for record class game.LandscapeCountSquare
    the constructor checks that player is in fact real and makes a copy of it just to be sure it doesn't try changing mid counting

    T

    tiles() - Method in class game.DrawSquare
    draw is the public getter for the tiles field
    TileSquare - Class in game
    TileSquare represents a Square version of a tile for Cascadia landscape is a field representing the landscape of a tile animalAccepted is a field representing the animals accepted by thiss tile animal is a field representing the current animal on this tile
    TileSquare(Set<WildlifeToken>, WildlifeToken, Landscape) - Constructor for class game.TileSquare
    TileSquare, the constructor, checks if animalAccepted and landscape do exist, animal can be null
